Sentencas: The influence of steam on the internal reforming reaction in solid oxide fuel cells is under debate based on previously reported results.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: Therefore, appropriate kinetic models that accurately describe the methane reforming behaviour in solid oxide fuel cells under various operating conditions are required.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: The objective of this study is to find the appropriate kinetic model to describe the effect of current density on steam adsorption behaviour.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: The Langmuir-Hinshelwood model considers the associative methane adsorption and the dissociative steam adsorption.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: The formation of catalyst-hydroxide complexes is directly influenced by the steam concentration and current drawn via the non-faradaic electrochemical modification of the catalysis effect.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: The steam adsorption constant appeared to significantly drop when a current was produced.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: Of the current densities investigated, the models seemed to provide a more accurate description of reforming rates at a 600 A/m2 current density relative to open-circuit and 1000 A/m2 conditions.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode

Sentencas: The models are used to predict the reaction rate in the fuel cell channel where the in-situ measurement is not practical.
Titulo: Effect of electrochemical reaction on steam adsorption during methane reforming on a Ni-GDC anode
